page.title: 02BOXGROVE - THE SCHOOL
page.content: was about 1000 and even more so since 1930 when the population was 1300. {BOXGROVE C. OF E. SCHOOL.}The School was opened in 1741 when the Countess of Derby gave some money to build a School, a house for the headmaster and 12 Almshouses for the old ladies from Boxgrove, Lavant and Tangmere. Before that time only children of rich people had any school education but Mary the Countess of Derby said that the poor children had to have education. On the wall of the original Schoolhouse is an engraved notice which says,{"These {buildings were erected and Endowed by {the right honourable Mary Countefs {Dowager of Derby Daughter and heirefs {of Sir William Morley late of Halnaker {Knight of the moft honourable order of {ye Bath."}Like the village the number of children at the school has dropped from 190 in 1950, to 33 in 1985.
